arts.sum: However, Daniel Farke remains adamant that the Frenchman or a dip in form won’t cost his side promotion this season. Daniel Farke believes there is a 100% chance of Leeds United being promoted this season, despite being two adrift of top.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Leeds denied top spot by late Swansea leveller
arts.sum: Drama at Elland Road as Vipotnik strikes in added time Flemming free-kick helps Burnley maintain top-two tilt Leeds missed the chance to return to the top of the Championship as they conceded in the sixth minute of added time to draw 2-2 at home to Swansea. The hosts made the ideal start as they looked to respond to Sheffield United’s Friday night win over Coventry, with Brenden Aaronson bundling the ball home inside a minute. Swansea were handed a chance to level from the spot in the 14th minute, only for Illan Meslier to turn Josh Tymon’s penalty behind. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Joe Rothwell sums Leeds, Meslier howlers up
arts.sum: Leeds United were forced to settle for a 2-2 draw at home to Swansea City as a 96th minute leveller from Zan Vipotnik found its way through Illan Meslier. A scrappy goal inside the first minute from Brenden Aaronson looked to put Leeds on their way to victory very early but a shaky performance allowed the Swans an avenue to test Illan Meslier.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke addresses Illan Meslier position debate after 'heartbreaking' Leeds United moment
arts.sum: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke could not hide his disappointment after his side missed the chance to go back to the top of the Championship. After such a heart-breaking game they don't need a manager to put the disappointment on the players.

arts.ttl: Meslier HOWLERS as Leeds are held 2-2 by Swansea
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Leeds United and Swansea City.

arts.ttl: Super sub Zan Vipotnik scores late equaliser as Swansea hold high-flying Leeds
arts.sum: Willy Gnonto came off the bench to score a 86th-minute goal which looked set to give Leeds victory – but Vipotnik fired home a late equaliser.

arts.ttl: Meslier HOWLER gifts Swansea equaliser vs Leeds!
arts.sum: Illan Meslier's howler gifted Swansea's Harry Darling the opportunity to equalise against Leeds.

arts.ttl: Leeds v Swansea, Bayern Munich v St Pauli, and more: football – live
arts.sum: Follow updates from Saturday afternoon’s kick-offs Live scoreboard | The latest league tables | Mail Emillia Leeds starting line-up: Meslier, Bogle, Byram, Struijk, Rodon, Ampadu (C), Rothwell, Solomon, Aaronson, James, Piroe. Substitutes: Darlow, Firpo, Schmidt, Gruev, Tanaka, Guilavogui, Ramazani, Joseph, Gnonto. Swansea starting line-up: Vigouroux, Key, Fulton, Cabango (C), Darling, O’Brien, Tymon, Franco, Cullen, Delcroix, Ronald. Substitutes: McLaughlin, Allen, Vipotnik, Eom, Bianchini, Christie, Naughton, Cooper, Parker. Reims v Marseille (4pm GMT) St Étienne v PSG (6pm GMT) Monaco v Nice (8:05pm GMT) Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Leeds United team news vs Swansea City as Wilfried Gnonto and Junior Firpo decisions made
arts.sum: Gnonto will not start the game, with Brenden Aaronson - who missed out on US squad selection over the international break - beginning his 37th straight league game. Starting XI: Meslier; Bogle, Rodon, Struijk, Byram; Ampadu, Rothwell; James, Aaronson, Solomon; Piroe

arts.ttl: Joe Rodon sends classy Leeds United tribute to Christopher Loftus and Kevin Speight
arts.sum: Joe Rodon has sent a message of support to the family of Christopher Loftus and Kevin Speight ahead of Leeds United ’s tribute gestures against Swansea City this afternoon. And ahead of kick-off against Swansea this weekend, Rodon has, on behalf of the whole squad, sent a message to the loved ones of both late club heroes.
